channel.title: Moparscape Operating System Emulator Thingy
channel.description:
I was really bored again so I made you guys an epic program! Introducing the Moparscape Operating System!!! Please run it and try it out. (No pictures because that'll ruin the suprise)
Download: [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=439128.0;attach=17976]here[/url]
Source: [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=439128.0;attach=17977]here![/url]
note: remember this isn't an actual OS, it's just something i made for fun :D

item.title: Moparscape Operating System Emulator Thingy
item.dc:creator: @pauline pauline
item.description:
@pauline wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:30, topic:342725”][quote author=pauline link=topic=439128.msg3244809#msg3244809 date=1277258510]

Wtf is this? What language is this coded in? Or is this like a branch of linux?

[size=24pt]Meh, but it was an executable jar.[/size]
Seeing as the OS file is a JAR, a person that can observe well would automatically assume Java.

But you know, you can think of it as Linux. You’ll just be wrong.

A jar file is really just an archive format, anything could be in it, including a Linux distribution. Although it is unlikely.

Now, Java’s Bitch, I am more than capable of reading what Moparisthebest had posted. You do not need to quote exactly what he posted without even adding a comment, or correcting anything. Useless redundancy.

@moparisthebest: I know that JARs may be used as simply archives, but the odds, as you said, are slim. It is an archive format designed really for Java applications, so they may be ran with ease (as you well know).
[/quote]I’m sorry that I messed up my quote, here I’ll point it out for you. As you can see I was supporting you, and why you would have said it. But as I stated before I thought it may have been a real distribution of a real operating system, because I didn’t download the file to find a JAR executable, I thought it was something more than a meager joke.
Learn to read, it will help you later in life.
Oh and if you wanna seem like a professional asshole like 90% of this forum does you might wanna start learning to be more mature.
Example 1:

Java’s Bitch[/quote]

Now, if you would have actually posted correctly, then we would have avoided this dispute.

p.s. I do not need your assistance on how to be mature. Obviously, you are the wrong person to be even be giving others a hard time about being mature, as you are severely immature.

Read full topic

It is an archive format designed really for Java applications, so they may be ran with ease (as you well know).[/quote]I’m sorry that I messed up my quote, here I’ll point it out for you. But as I stated before I thought it may have been a real distribution of a real operating system, because I didn’t download the file to find a JAR executable, I thought it was something more than a meager joke.
Learn to read, it will help you later in life.
Oh and if you wanna seem like a professional asshole like 90% of this forum does you might wanna start learning to be more mature.
Example 1:

Java's Bitch

Wtf is this? What language is this coded in? Or is this like a branch of linux?

Meh, but it was an executable jar.
Seeing as the OS file is a JAR, a person that can observe well would automatically assume Java.

But you know, you can think of it as Linux. You’ll just be wrong.

A jar file is really just an archive format, anything could be in it, including a Linux distribution. Although it is unlikely.
[/quote][/quote]

Now, Java’s Bitch, I am more than capable of reading what Moparisthebest had posted. You do not need to quote exactly what he posted without even adding a comment, or correcting anything. Useless redundancy.

@moparisthebest: I know that JARs may be used as simply archives, but the odds, as you said, are slim. It is an archive format designed really for Java applications, so they may be ran with ease (as you well know).
